vision.title: DOCTOR OF MANAGEMENT SCIENCE PROGRAM
vision.description: Amidst exponential change, digital disruption, and global uncertainty, only leaders with sharp vision, strong strategy, and innovative courage can navigate the future. Specifically designed for leaders and policymakers, the Doctor of Management Science Program at STIE Mahardhika Surabaya serves as a strategic platform to deepen strategic understanding, expand managerial insights, and cultivate visionary thinking. A space where knowledge and values merge into a force to <0>mold visionary leaders in the era of global complexity.</0>

competence.title: GRADUATE COMPETENCIES
competence.subtitle: This program shapes superior leaders and thinkers with strategic sharpness, principled leadership, and sustainable vision in four core areas of modern management:

items.title: Strategic Marketing
items.description: Creating value innovation in the digital era.

items.title: HR Management & Transformational Leadership
items.description: Building adaptive organizations based on ethics.

items.title: Finance & Organizational Sustainability
items.description: Integrating strategic analysis with performance, value, and social responsibility.

curriculum.title: DOCTOR OF MANAGEMENT SCIENCE PROGRAM
curriculum.description: This program presents <0>an adaptive 42-credit curriculum</0> blending structured learning, in-depth research, colloquiums, international publications, and strategic dissertation. Designed specifically for <1>professionals, academics, and executives</1>, this program can be completed in <2>6 semesters (3 years)</2> with a directed and progressive study path.

items.title: Hybrid Learning Experience
items.description: Flexible and relevant to professional dynamics.

items.title: Strategic Research & Case-Based Learning
items.description: Addressing real organizational challenges as a space for scientific exploration.

items.title: Doctoral Colloquium & Mentorship Intensive
items.description: Personal mentoring from promoters and experienced experts.

items.title: Global Network & Collaborative Publication
items.description: Opening access to research networks and international collaboration.
